metadata.title: CVE-2024-26760 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:target: pscsi: Fix bio_put() for error case As of commit 066ff571011d("block: turn bio_kmalloc into a simple kmalloc wrapper"), a bio allocatedby bio_kmalloc() must be freed by bio_uninit() and kfree(). That is notdone properly for the error case, hitting WARN and NULL pointer dereferencein bio_free().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
